name: Joseph Clay Miller
body:
I am an app developer with a passion for games and puzzles. I started developing web games with flash. Most recently I have been making HTML5 games with JavaScript.

## Web Games

### [Tic-Tac-Toe](http://josephclaymiller.github.io/Tic-Tac-Toe/)
![Tic-Tac-Toe](http://josephclaymiller.github.io/images/Tic_Tac_Toe_screenshot.png)

This game is played by 2 players alternating turns. Each turn a player clicks an empty tile to place a mark. The first player to place 3 marks in a row wins. It is built in JavaScript with jQuery.
[View the code on GitHub](https://github.com/josephclaymiller/Tic-Tac-Toe).

### [Snake](http://josephclaymiller.github.io/Snake/) 
![Snake](http://josephclaymiller.github.io/images/snake_screenshot.png)

Single player game of snake. Use the arrow keys to move the snake around the board. Eat apples to increase the length of the snake. You lose if the snake goes off the board or eats itself. It is built in JavaScript with jQuery and Underscore.js.
[View the code on GitHub](https://github.com/josephclaymiller/Snake).

### [Memory](http://josephclaymiller.github.io/Memory/)
![Memory](http://josephclaymiller.github.io/images/memory_screenshot.png)

Game of Memory built in JavaScript with jQuery and Underscore.js. You gain points by selecting matching pairs of tiles.
